title: [Neuroscience] New blood test gives very high accuracy to screen for Alzheimer’s disease. A new blood test called p-tau217 shows promise as an Alzheimer’s disease biomarker, and when used in a two-step workflow very high accuracy to either identify or exclude brain amyloidosis, the earliest pathology.

[Medicine] Sepsis (bloodstream infections) is as common as cancer, as deadly as a heart attack. A new Swedish study found that sepsis is more common than previously believed (750 per 100,000 adults). Over 4% of all hospitalizations involved sepsis, and 20% of all sepsis patients died within 3 months.
